meanings.definition: A member of a primitive race of cave-dwellers.
meanings.sent1: The troglodytes lived in caves and hunted for food.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologists discovered ancient troglodytes' tools in the cave.
meanings.sent3: The troglodytes had a unique way of communicating through cave drawings.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the troglodytes symbolized a connection to the earth and its history.
meanings.sent5: The troglodytes' lifestyle was simple yet fascinating to study.

meanings.definition: A person who is regarded as being deliberately ignorant or old-fashioned.
meanings.sent1: Some people consider him a troglodytes because he refuses to use modern technology.
meanings.sent2: The troglodytes at the meeting opposed any changes to the traditional way of doing things.
meanings.sent3: It's amusing how he proudly embraces his troglodytes persona in this digital age.
meanings.sent4: She described her stubborn boss as a troglodytes stuck in the past.
meanings.sent5: The troglodytes' resistance to progress was evident in their actions.

meanings.sent1: The troglodytes in the zoo were playful and curious creatures.
meanings.sent2: Researchers observed the troglodytes grooming each other in their natural habitat.
meanings.sent3: It was funny to watch the troglodytes mimic the zoo visitors' actions.
meanings.sent4: The troglodytes' agile movements in the trees were a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: Children were delighted to see the troglodytes swinging from branch to branch.
